statement.p: Let A be a symmetric matrix. Explain step by step how to find an orthonormal basis of eigenvectors of A. (Be sure to consider the case when not all eigenvalues of A are distinct).
Let A be a symmetric matrix. Explain step by step how to find an matrix U and a diagonal matrix D such that A = UDU^T and U^T = U\inv.
Let A be a symmetric matrix. Explain step by step how to find a spectral decomposition of A.
Let A be a symmetric matrix. If \lambda is a root of \det(A-\lambda I) of multiplicity k , explain why the null space of A-\lambda I has dimension k.
Let A be a symmetric matrix with eigenvalues \lambda_1, \lambda_2 and the corresponding eigenvectors v1, v2. Assume \lambda_1 = \lambda_2. Explain why v1, v2 are orthogonal.

Let Q: \R^n\to\R be a quadratic form, that is, a function of the form \sum_{i, j=1}^n a_{ij} x_i x_j where a_{ij} are real numbers and x_k is the kth coordinate on \R^n. Explain how to find a symmetric n \times n matrix A such that Q(x)=Ax\cdot x for all x in \R^n.

Let Q(x) = Ax\cdot x where A is a symmetric n \times n matrix with eigenvalues \lambda_1, \ldots , \lambda_n. Explain how to find a change of variables so that Q becomes \lambda_1 {y_1}^2 + \cdots + \lambda_n {y_n}^2).
Let Q(x) = Ax\cdot x where A is a symmetric n \times n matrix. Explain why Q(x) > 0 for every x \neq 0 if and only if every eigenvalue of A is positive.
Let Q(x) = Ax\cdot x where A is a symmetric n \times n matrix. Explain why Q(x) \geq 0 for every x \neq 0 if and only if every eigenvalue of A is nonnegative.

Let Q(x) = Ax\cdot x where A is a symmetric n \times n matrix with eigenvalues \lambda_1, \ldots , \lambda_n and an orthonormal basis of eigenvectors u_1,\ldots, u_n, where Au_i=\lambda_i u_i. What are the maximum and the minimum of the function Q(x)Q(x) under the constrain \|x\|=1? For which x are the the maximum and the minimum attained?

Let A be a symmetric n \times n such that Q_A(x) = Ax\cdot x is positive definite. Explain why the matrix A\inv is invertible and symmetric. Explain why the quadratic form Q_{A\inv}(x) = A\inv x\cdot x is positive definite.
If A and B are symmetric matrices whose eigenvalues are positive, explain why the eigenvalues of A+B are positive.
